reviews_data.review_text:
Best frittata I have ever had! This place is a real gem! The service was excellent, several breakfast options for vegetarians, and the coffee was great. I was surprised how small it was, but the atmosphere feels intimate like family. This place will be on regular rotation!
Quality, excellent. Service, excellent. Food, excellent. Atmosphere, typical.
This hidden gem is phenomenal. The food, service, and atmosphere is a great meet up spot to have a conversation without being too loud.
I moved to Virginia 3 years ago, but I am from this area and every time I visit I HAVE to come here! A hidden gem in Kannapolis/Concord.

We had an amazing time dining here tonight! The brie dip was absolutely delicious and the perfect "small bite" sharing size for the three of us! The service was amazing! Grace was our server and she was kind and courteous. Locally owned and operated--great atmosphere for dinner! Only problem we ran into was too many delicious options... We will happily be back!!!!

I cannot give six stars so I will give five. Every experience at this establishment is as good as the last. Their food is fresh and tasty. They have a wonderful selection of food and beverages. Their service is very nice, and the "Piece de resistance" that the owner visits every table to ensure his customers are pleased. They have wonderful events and You can find them on Facebook. Enjoy this little gem of a restaurant. My only regret is that there place is not bigger..
But perhaps it's just perfectly perfect the size that it is?
the food is okay lots of options , the place is nice inside aswell. However to put bluntly not very welcoming. My friends and I were treated indifferently....
My new breakfast spot! Very nice e soothing atmosphere.  A great place to bring someone for breakfast...

The Turkey and Gouda sandwiches on sourdough bread is absolutely delicious!!!  
Tots were crispy!!  
We went on Tuesday and it was 1/2 price bottles of wine!!!!
Food as absolutely delicious! Great atmosphere.

This place was so cute and cozy. The wine was delicious and the food was amazing. We had the meatballs and Mac and cheese. One of the best in the charlotte area. The servers were so nice and helpful and the owner was even there and so kind. Will definitely be back to try more!

We went here on a whim with some friends because it was a very nice in between location. We had such a blast and the food was excellent. The chef even came out and spoke with us for a little while to ask us how hermeals were and tell us a little bit more about what we got to eat. Everything was made from scratch and was delicious. The wine list was lovely and they also had a small but nice selection of beers.
We really enjoyed it and would definitely love to come back!

Walked in the door with my family, was greeted and told the restaurant was full. Didn't offer a wait time or apologies. Was told "we're not the kind of restaurant that hurries their guests out the door"! How rude!
Always great food and a pleasant dining experience at Grounds & Vine!  The owners pay close attention to their customers - a rarity in the fast paced, impersonal world we live in.

Lovely little bistro. We took a chance based on the website menu, and we are glad we did. The Owner himself spoke with us as he learned we were travelling from Canada. Atmosphere is lovely. Decor is local artist gallery space, a wonderful idea. Food is amazing. Baked Brie with Apples, Bacon, and Pecans appetizer is a delicious start. Harvest Flatbread has a great balance of Sweet (apples) and salty (blue cheese crumble.) Lobster Bisque soup of the day is a great contender.  And of course, the Three Cheese Grilled Cheese is beautiful. Stretchy and a good mix of cheeses. All in all, a definite place to try if you're local, and a nice place to try if you're stopping in. Big Daddy G is a great chef, and thanks for the conversation with a couple of wandering Canucks. (The food looked and smelled so good we didn't have time to take a photo until halfway done...lol.)
Amazing!!! Try the white lavendar coffee!!

I stopped here with a friend for lunch. We had the Turkey and Gouda as well as the Chef Special - Grilled Chicken Club which had a delicious mustard sauce. Both sandwiches were great! We also had a Rose wine flight and a cookie butter latte. Everything was extremely tasty and the food that was going by us looked amazing as well. There is not a ton of space, so I'd imagine there could be a wait, especially for brunch or dinner. Parties of more than 6 would probably not be able to be accommodated easily. There is a small kids section on the menu, but since it's a tight space, I'd recommend probably leaving the kiddos at home. Great wine selection as well as some tasty beer bottle selections and few on tap as well. I would definitely recommend this place and plan on coming back soon!
Wonderful experience!!! Great food, great staff, and great coffee!!! 10/10

Great little wine bar/restaurant with a full menu. Food was reasonably priced and delicious. Staff was great!  I normally don't post reviews but felt compelled to review this spot. Local owners! Eat local!
The best meatballs!
Great food, drinks and service...

First time at Grounds & Vine. Greeted warmly when we walked in. Stopped for lunch, my husband had a glass of wine & I had a peppermint mocha coffee (I was freezing that day). My husband ordered the Reuben sandwich and a bowl of butternut squash soup. I ordered the Ham & Swiss with a bowl of the same soup. Everything was so delicious! My ham sandwich had a spicy mustard made in house by the owner, Rich. It has attitude -the mustard not Rich- and I loved it. Unfortunately I didn't take pictures of the food. Rich pulled up a chair and chatted with us a bit-so friendly. We'll definitely go back!

Not impressed. This was our first visit. I ordered a Coke that was totally flat. I then asked for an orange juice. I don't know what it was. It was either orange juice that was very diluted or maybe an orange pineapple mixture. I don't know, but it wasn't good. Someone apparently forgot to make the tater tots we ordered and I asked that they cancel it, but they brought it anyway. The server forgot to bring water that was asked for. It's a shame because the food was actually quite tasty, but I don't really want to come back due to the service.
Friendly
It's a 4 star because of over pricing. Happy to return and support local business.
Treats staff poorly
First time here. Personal is friendly. Food tastes good. Recommend

Great food. Everything we tried was fantastic. The bruschetta was phenomenal and a great start to the meal. The Ruben was well done and a great combination of flavors. The loaded tots were full of flavor as well. My fiance had the lobster mac and cheese and it was delicious. I will say that the service was a little on the slow side for refilling waters as we sat with empty glasses for some time. Would I go back again....absolutely. Almost forgot. I did have the bourbon pecan latte and it rocked. Would highly recommend reservations after being there. It is small and justifiably very busy
Dine inside or outside. Great unique food selections. Loved it!
Mimosa flights are the best here gonna come here every weekend
Went in for dinner - ended up at wine tasting night! Good food, friendly service, and tasty wine.

TERRIBLE!!!!!!! From the time I walked in until the time I walked out I was so dissapointed in the lack of humanity !  The ladies working there would not even look up to greet whomever walked in .    The food was far from what expected !   So disgusted !   Will not be returning and will share my experience in the community.    Very sad that this is a locally owned business with such poor customer service .Lets do better guys!!!!!!
The coffee and food were both original and top notch.  If you stay long enough, the owner will likely come say hello as well.

Came to Charlotte for a race. Visited Randy Lajoye's shop to drop off the trailer, and say hi. Right around the corner, is this place. The place is very homie, with a fireplace and coffee counter. The Cuban sandwich was perfect. The roast pork on that sandwich was just amazing. The tots with the pimento cheese was so good, I kept eating them after I was stuffed. If you end up in this area, this place is a must stop spot.

Conveniently located at the end of a small office building so that parking is abundant during the weekend. It's coffee, wine, and a craft menu but the focus must be on wine and food because the service for coffee was a bit weak. They might have been short on staff when I stopped by, I ordered for dine-in and they still brought it to me in a takeaway cup. The vibe was off so I made use of the takeaway cup

Enjoyed this place immensely with my husband about a month  ago and couldn't wait to bring friends back. Shared that with the owner who greeted us  us the first time .
Saturday we had reservations for four at 6:30 the patio. The owner recognized us, I confirmed that that we enjoyed it so much I brought our friends. Sadly,  our experience was NOT GOOD this time. Initially when we got there they were not very busy but it still took us 23 minutes to get a drink. I went to the owner at 21 minutes and ask if we could get our drink order or at least water ?   He replied with an answer about how they were probably taking care of other people... clearly that was the case. He  had two servers for  too many people. The young lady was  knowledgeable and  efficient  but overwhelmed .The young man was clearly not as well informed about the menu and definitely a new waiter , asked us repeatedly about our order . drink glasses dry more than once,  dirty dishes left on the table until  I finally asked for them to be removed.
Bottom line is we were not taken  care of.  I feel like the owner had an opportunity to save it for us acknowledging the delay and instead after finally getting our drinks the rest of the meal service flowed the same way. Our dining experience ,although still wonderful because of our friends, was not enhanced by my restaurant choice this time. My husband and I love to eat, and  we both worked in food service in college he an excellent waiter/ lime cook and myself a bartender and waitress. So we appreciate good service. He says we're not going back, I might give them more chance because the food is good and they are very conveniently located for us.

What a great, family owned place! I got the half sammie and soup $11.50. I chose the grilled 3 cheese that was so cheesy, the bread gave way before the cheese. The tomato bisque was very flavorful and the balsamic drizzle was a wonderful touch.  I ate every bite. My Aunt got the half sammie and side salad. She chose the Turkey Gouda as her sandwich.  She also ate every bite. The service was good and the atmosphere was cozy coffee/wine cafe. I would return.
I had a Mocha Late and it was delicious ! The cafe has beautiful art pieces and the staff is friendly.

Been wanting to try Grounds and Vine since they opened, but life just got in the way. My husband made "surprise" reservations to celebrate my birthday. When I learned we were having dinner here, I was really looking forward to it.
When we walked in, my husband said we had reservations, and we were immediately seated at a quaint little table for two on the patio. We were immediately presented with plastic cups filled with water, and straws.
The owner introduced himself (didn't mention his name, but said he was the owner) and we told him how excited we were to have dinner at a local Kannapolis NC restaurant owned by someone from the Midwest, which is where we are from, too.
The owner talked about the sauces and what he is planning to do in the near future of the food here, and we are PUMPED to see this evolution, especially since we like spicy most times, but it's very nice to have milder options. When we started asking questions about the wines, the owner sent his wife out to deal with our inquiries. Tell you what! - If you like trying wines from everywhere- and I mean Everywhere! - this place is for you! Bring your reading glasses so you can study the wine list. If you're looking for something specific, it's HERE! His wife didn't share her name either, but she was so Sweet!!!! And very educated about the wine. She found the PERFECT wine for my husband (ended up being from the largest family owned vineyard in NC), and found one for me (from Portugal) that I liked so much I bought a bottle to take home!
In the midst of figuring out the right wine, we ordered the loaded tater tots. These were HEAVENLY! - Totally hit the spot! Unfortunately, once we got through the Tater tots and the (very generous) wine samples, we sat twiddling our thumbs for about 20 minutes before someone came to take our "actual" drink and dinner order. No big deal today as we were not in a hurry like usual. We decided to try the Octoberfest German wine flight (so
we could decide what might be other options to pair best with our dinner as well as an enjoyable wine to savor after dinner), which was a great sampling of German wines to fit almost every pallet. We also ordered from the "Chef's Specials" dinner menu.
Our flights came about 7 minutes later from when we ordered, followed by our dinner about another 8 minutes later. Our plates looked stellar! - Beautiful Plating!
We were half way through dinner before we had a chance to order our wine we thought would pair the best.
Our bill, with the tip pre-populated on the screen came to just under $130.00. - Not too bad for great hospitality and atmosphere, as well as a bottle of good wine to savor later.
We plan to go back; maybe for lunch as the sandwiches we saw looked Incredibly delicious. We're also looking forward to the new, hand-crafted sauces. The owner and his wife are wonderful people! A definite "must try it out for yourself"! (The coffee menu looks amazing as well, but specialty coffees are not my thing. I drink green tea.)
Check it out!

First time trying here. Took my wife for her birthday. Had heard nothing but great things about the food. Owner from Ohio. We're originally from Wisconsin. Thought Midwestern food, how could we go wrong. The good! Very hospitable. Greeted by owner at our table. He sent his wife out because he is the food guy and she is the wine expert. Many to choose from. She did very good and was very personable. I had the best blackberry wine I have ever had. The loaded tater tots. Best I have had in many years. Definitely a must try if you dine here. Atmosphere was great. Beautiful patio and nice little dining area. Being from Wisconsin, bonus they had the Brewers game on. We opted for the patio. Actually a nice little view over looking the side road off hwy 73. Now on to the bad. I chose the "no pasta lasagna" and my wife had the "baked salmon". The lasagna had a layer of burned cheese covered by a layer of freshly baked mozzarella. The mozzarella was great. However,  the rest had the burnt flavor all the way through. The sauce wasn't the worst I've had, but definitely could have used something to sweeten up. Had the bitter taste of tomato paste. The garlic bread was actually really good. Great crisp, but yet soft center which is difficult to do for homemade. Overall, I would give that meal a 2 out of 5. My wife's salmon meal a different story. We'll start with the bland rice. Just plain white rice with nothing added. The asparagus was like it never cooked. My wife never leaves asparagus, but she ate 4 bites and said no. The baked salmon was so baked,it looked like it was overseared in a fry pan and was so dry it had to actually be cut to eat it. The roumalade sauce to my wife tasted like Dijon mustard. When the owner asked how our food was, my wife told him the salmon was way overcooked and the sauce had way too much Dijon mustard. His reply was it doesn't have any mustard and he walked away. Did not like the criticism at all. I do understand. I want to think everything coming out of my kitchen is top notch,but when it's not, I also want to take the time to learn why and improve on the mistakes. I was disappointed in the fact that he knew it was our first time there, my wife's birthday,and he didn't even show an ounce of care about her having a satisfying meal. Very disappointed actually. Also, we did end up sitting for about 20 minutes between finishing our appetizer and $25 wine flight before our waitress reappeared and asked if we were ready to order a drink and our dinner. Overall, not the worst place we've been, and we will definitely go back. We also give a 3 strike system and from what we have heard, the sandwiches here are to die for. Not a great experience this time for us. But if you are going to take your spouse out for a nice birthday evening, I would think it through as to where you choose. Overall not a bad deal for an appetizer, 2 bad main courses, a wine flight and 2 glasses of wine. Just under $130 with a 19% tip included.
This is a hidden gem!  The owners and staff provide excellent service.  The is food always excellent, cozy atmosphere with a great selection of wine to choose from.
Great local place for coffee and a good breakfast. Service was great. Locally owned and operated.
One of my favorite brunch places  now!
Terrible service and pretentious.
A favorite of ours when we are in that area.
Didn't even know about this place until I looked up new brunch spots around me. 10/10 food and service. Will 100% be coming back consistently

We were passing through NC,  I looked up Gluten Free near me. It listed this restaurant.  What a great choice!! My choice was barbecue flat bread. It was the best flatbread I've ever had! The owner's hand made sauce should be bottled. The owner was personable and checked on customers and their orders.  We will definitely stop at this restaurant again when driving in the area.
came in at 7:22, coffee shop opens at 7am. they had no coffee available, had not finished brewing any. left unable to buy.

OUTSTANDING!
The Grounds & Vine is a uncut Dimond. The service, wine, atmosphere and food are top notch! The owner adds a personalized touch by speaking with each customer and checking on their comfort and satisfaction. I'll be back on my way back to Maryland.
We were pleased with everything.  Such a comfortable, welcoming spot with fresh tasty food and drinks, all served with gracious hospitality.
Dinner was delicious.

I live like 5 minutes from here, but I didn't even know about them. Found them through Google. This place is a hidden gem of a restaurant if you like Flatbread or a good sammich. I will definitely be back to try other stuff.

They also have coffees and other stuff on the menu, so I can't speak to all of it, but I have a bbq pulled pork sliders and tater tots, and it was fantastic. Cine to find out the tips were airfield. Nothing deep fried here, so there's that healthy side of it. My friend had their spin on a Cuban, and he also enjoyed it.

The place is small, but they have outdoor seating, and it was very enjoyable. Bringing the wife next time.

Nice and cozy atmosphere but my Honey lavender latte with oat milk was cold on the first sip. An older individual was checking on guests and I let him know my latte was a little cold. He took the cup and went and put it in the microwave. When brought it back to me he said it's 150 degrees, I chuckled and he said just sip it. I spent $14 for egg & cheese on a bagel and a latte. Took only one sip of my latte and it looked like this.

Went for some coffee and appetizers on a Saturday evening. The coffee was great !! They have an extensive menu for wine and the food is amazing too. Tried bruschetta and flatbread and the bruschetta is on of the best I've had in the area. Loved it !
Cuban was fantastic!

This is a super cute cafe with a great outdoor space. The owners are very friendly and greet customers. I had the Cuban sandwich and the Pecan Bourbon Iced Latte. Very delicious and filling. They also have wine. This is a great place to chill or to get some work done. Next time I come back I want to sit outside by the fireplace it looks real cozy.
Tasty coffee brilliantly blended flavors....giving way to each flavor involved!
Food was wonderful! The bruschetta is a must have! The owner came out and personally introduced himself and was very kind. We would travel to visit again
Fantastic food and friendly owners. That Cuban sandwich is great.

6/25/24 - Went today for dine in lunch, busy. The apple/brie appetizer was great! Good food, just needed some seasoning. My friend asked for sugar (nice coffee portion but in a paper cup) and they brought her 1 packet. Then I asked for salt and pepper for the soup and she brought me 1 tiny packet of salt and 1 tiny packet of pepper. Service was friendly. Will be back again just maybe an off cook day.

(Original visit) So glad we tried it out! Had a great peach mimosa. The charcuterie board was a little skimpy but flavorful. The turkey gouda sammy and tomato soup were great! My friends'food looked good too, generous portions. Topped it off with a great latte. We'll definitely be back!!

Nice Christian place to get coffee and a light breakfast. I enjoyed the avocado toast. Would have preferred whole avocado instead guacamole style. Cortado was not bad but no latte art. I really enjoy when I see a nice rosetta, but no luck today. No brand marketing on the cup either. Bagel was a bit hard to chew.

They have wine events as well, but I have not been able to attend and experience them

Just stopped in on a whim. Needed some coffee, and I was driving by. Coffee was great. I noticed they have a full menu. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to get some food. I was in a rush, but I will be back and update my review. Either way, I will be returning for the coffee it's worth the trip.

When I first entered the restaurant I was greeted with smiles and a friendly welcome. Everyone was so nice and Anthony provided amazing service. The restaurant is decorated with a nice touch of class and a cozy atmosphere. I will most definitely be recommending to all my friends and family !
I enjoy the salads because they are always fresh. Lunch visits are taking longer and longer. I'll maybe only go after work at this point when I have time to be there longer than an hour.

Super cute, but food was majorly lacking. Got a coffee drink and a ham and swiss to go. The ham and swiss on the menu was listed as "Artisan ham & country swiss served on sourdough with vine-ripened tomatoes & greens w/stone ground mustard", supposed to be served with chips. Well. I got the ham and sourdough, MAYBE a smidge of cheese, and that was it. See attached photo. Didn't receive chips, no mustard, tomatoes, or greens. $12 is a LOT for two slices of ham on some bread. Drink is good, and a good size, so gave the food 2 stars, but the actual meal left a lot to be desired.
Nice relaxing place
Really good, but realized a week later that I was given the wrong bill and therefore paid more than I had ordered.
Food good service was good and it was nice and quiet
Amazing food! Everything was fresh cooked to order and dessert options heavenly
Food was absolutely delicious! I can't wait to go back! Owner and staff were very nice!! Serves coffee, food and wine!

Came in with a couple of friends to have a matcha and a quick bite. When the food came out, it had an ingredient that I, the customer, was allergic to. I asked the owner what could be done and i was met with a blank stare and a "you can try it" (an ingredient i'm allergic to??)  I understand if nothing could be done, but the attitude was very off, as if I was supposed to know what to do next. Very blank stare and minimum effort to find a solution. Waitress was amazing though! So was the matcha!
Delicious, cozy, and classy!
Excellent options (including many gluten free), coffees, and service; the owner is a delight. A lovely friend took me for my birthday breakfastI hope to be back soon.

My daughter's  baby shower was at Grounds & Vine on the outside patio. Wonderful experience! All 22 of the guests ordered from the menu and the food was served in a timely manner. They have a fantastic staff! My favorite is any of their flatbreads. The chicken salad was also a huge hit. All the guests raved about how they loved the food. Highly recommend!

This place is great! I highly recommend everything 
The food, tea, dessert & and lattes are some of the best I've had. I don't care for wine, but if you do. I will definitely dine here regularly. The owners and wait staff are very nice and accommodating. I totally give it 5 stars
Great little place!

What a great spot for breakfast and lunch! I spent about five hours there today while I worked remotely. Everyone was welcoming and their attentive service made my first visit memorable. The caprese sandwich was fresh and flavorful, and the pistachio white mocha latte was amazing. I look forward to coming back soon! Highly recommended for a coffee or lunch! The owner Rich came by multiple times after introducing himself to make sure everything was good. What great hospitality!

I will go against the grain on this one. Went there with my wife and was underwhelmed. All we got was the charcuterie board and mimosas, so I can't speak to anything else on the menu. I am no stranger to charcuterie boards or mimosas, and was disappointed in both. The charcuterie did not seem like it was put together or paired very well even, I have made better ones with ingredients from Aldi, for a fraction of the price. The mimosas were nearly undrinkable due to the extreme fizziness of the champagne, I have never experienced anything like that before. We will not be returning here.
Great vibe, coffee, food AND service!! This will be a new regular spot.
Great place! Quality offerings and atmosphere.

It was our 1st time visiting, and WE LOVED IT!!!!!! Perfect spot for brunch!! Great vibe, great atmosphere and an overall great experience as a first timer!!!! Definitely coming back, SOON!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
This place is magical!  Phenomenal coffee, wines, food and whipped cream.  We are huge fans, came from the Concord Diner but definitely staying here!
First time dining here and loved it. Service was great & food was Delicious. Intimate atmosphere including a fireplace. No loud music!  Has outdoor seating too.

This was the absolute worst experience I have had! The management staff is extremely unprofessional! The food was cold and nasty. Unfortunately the management staff was completely unhelpful in rectifying the issues. The owner came out visibly upset with our party and didn't offer any assistance. I will not be returning to this establishment. However the wait staff was wonderful.
DO NOT EAT HERE! WISH I COULD GIVE NO STARS. Rock hard tots. OWNER IS A SILLY KAREN
Terrible!
Great food in a cozy environment.

My fiance and I made the hour-long drive for a spontaneous lunch date this past Saturday and it was absolutely worth it. The diverse menu offered numerous options, and the drink menu, especially for wine lovers, was exceptional. We savored lobster Mac and cheese, meatball sliders, and a grilled cheese with bisque soup--flavors that were truly unparalleled. A bottle of mimosa added a delightful touch, and even the coffee, which I usually don't enjoy, won me over with its special blend. The owners' attentiveness and the staff's patience and friendliness made our visit memorable.

They have a lovely patio so the summer will be relaxing to have lunch dates on. I will say pricing was pretty good I think it can suit everyone's budget. They did a great job. We learned they have only been open for two years. Highly recommend this gem and looking forward to returning soon!
Dirty Chai is fantastic and so are their muffins

Great food and great atmosphere! This is the kind of place that makes you want to eat slow and savor every bite. From the food to the drinks, there is something for everyone. The menu is versatile, but not overwhelming. The owners are vested and you feel the teamwork as they all work seamlessly to make you feel welcomed and valued as a customer. My new spot whether I'm with my husband and kids or on my on. Can't wait to invite co-workers for our next working lunch!

Owners were present and seeing to peoples needs, very kind and polite. This food is unbelievably amazing at an unbelievable price! Wonderful atmosphere, wonderful staff and hands down the best Cuban in the state of North Carolina! Went for lunch one day and ended up going the rest of the week, then brought my family that weekend. This place knows value and experience, they are one of the last standing restaurants that care about you, your wallet, and your taste buds!

Cute little coffee place. The coffee was delicious and it had a a cozy Christmas vibe!
The chocolate croissant was warmed and amazing.
First time here and it was wonderful!!  I had the grilled chicken salad and it was perfect!  The staff here is so friendly   We will definitely be back again.  Love this little place!
Awesome place to visit. They take their coffee and hot chocolate seriously.

Stopped by for a quick lunch and chai and it was great! Nice little shop with a variety of options for sandwiches, soups and other things. The chai was nice and creamy as well. I had their fall special which was a chicken and bacon on Ciabatta, and it was great.
Good food

Wow! What a hidden gem! We went for breakfast and I'm restricted on my diet so I asked if they had sugar free latte options... she brings over a full list of like 7 or 8 flavors, they can mix & match, etc. I got the peanut butter latte with almond milk and wow it was amazing. We shared the egg bites & they were so delicious! We will absolutely be coming back! The cleanliness and ambiance were top tier! And the owners/staff were so sweet!

Was in the area visiting family and my mom loves this place, so she took us there to give it a try. It's definitely a cute place and the atmosphere was great. Tighter seating inside but a nice sized patio as well, which even had heating lamps. We were greeted and seated by the owner as soon as we entered the building, he was very friendly. They had a nice selection of coffees and a big selection of wines to choose from. I was pleasantly surprised by the big selection of food options as well. Which we ordered a flatbread and a piece of cake, both were absolutely amazing! Wish we lived in the area to try other foods on the menu. The only thing was when we first ordered a bottle of wine, the server never told us they were out of that bottle until after we had all the food at the table, which typically you'd get the wine before the food. Then after we ordered a second option, it took 2 serves to locate that bottle, which still took close to 10 mins to get after the food. Other than that, which maybe just needs some organization, the place and food were amazing. We'll definitely go back when we're in the area again!
Owner and staff very friendly! Food was fantastic! I look forward to my next trip and try something new!
Great food, coffee and an amazing vibe. Owner was warm and friendly. 10/10 will be back.
Friendly service and good coffee! Nice place for a chat with a friend or to get some work done.

With the plethora of chain food options in Kannapolis and Concord, it so refreshing to have a true local place.  Rich and Sarah truly make you feel at home and want to make sure you have a first class experience.  Flatbreads are amazing, soups, salads, meatballs also are standouts. The Cuban might be my favorite.  Their staff is top notch and so friendly.  You gotta go.
Great food and service!
It is a cute specialty coffee, wine, beer place with good food and a quiet, sweet atmosphere. The servers are very nice and attentive!

My family & I are in North Carolina visiting family, and we stumbled upon this local gem.

We tried several different dishes and beverages, and let's just say they deserve more than 5-stars.

I highly recommend you stop by if you're in the area. Thoroughly and truly enjoyed ourselves.
My favorite coffee shop in the Carolinas looking forward to getting back there for a delicious coffee and a snack
Nice little spot for wine and coffee.  Their food is really good too
Hidden  Gem

Unfortunately the service here is not good. When you have regulars that come in every week and order the same thing only to be brought out something else and then told you're wrong? Then charged for both drinks when they took the wrong order away. This was one bad experience but, they have lost loyal customers.

Randomly found this place on Google while traveling for work and gave it a shot. I'm glad I did because this place is amazing. I ordered the Bees Knees latte which has lavender, local honey, and coconut extract. It was delightful. I also had a blueberry muffin that they received fresh from a local bakery. It was also excellent. The owner (Rick?) came up to chat with me for a minute and was super friendly. Overall the service was excellent. I will be back here the next time I'm in the area.

Update: I was back in the area for work again and stopped by. Still just as great as last time!
I love this local, neighborhood restaurant! The food is delicious, the owners & staff are pleasant, and the wine is plentiful. You really need to make this spot a habit.

Great food and atmosphere.  I enjoy going to this restaurant for a delicious meal and a nice glass of wine.  The servers are always polite and helpful.  The owner always makes a point of visiting each table.   Highly recommend.

This was my first experience with this restaurant. The food and service were excellent! The ambiance was delightful! They have great menu options and a great wine selection as well. The prices were very affordable and the quality of the food was outstanding! I'm looking forward to visiting again soon!
Audrey Steele Kirby

"This place is wonderful. It has such a lovely vibe. I really enjoyed my coffee and dessert. Even though I don't speak English, it was surprisingly easy to communicate with the girl at the counter, as she speaks Spanish, English, and a bit of Portuguese.  I'm from Cuba  and my partner is from Portugal, so we speak both languages. It's great to find people so well-prepared to assist customers. We will definitely be back soon."
I stopped in for a glass of ice tea. It was the best jasmine I ever had. This is a lovely place to get together for an easy dinner or lunch. Quiet. Nicely decorated. Very comfortable.
Great food and the service is warm and efficient. Servers Emmie, Savannah and Kenzie were wonderful!
Love this little place for coffee and brunch! Owners are always so polite and caring.
Great local coffee and bakery shop. The food is so so good and the atmosphere is chill and welcoming. They also feature local artists selling their art on their walls.
Absolutely delicious food. Super nice and attentive staff
Love the food and service. We really enjoy the wine tastings
The Triple G is a great sandwich. Heck, it's a meal!
This place is wonderful, service great, food very good.
Great unique food that is reasonable priced. Expansive, by the glass, wine selection. Service was very attentive
Great experience every time the food is fresh and the staff is great
First time there. Loved it. We'll be back!

Ooh, I have to say, I loved it. The food was really good. Very simple, but very good. Avocado toast and a sausage patty. The coffee was local honey, lavender, and coconut milk. WOW! Savana was really nice and a wonderful server.

Would been a very easy 5 star review. We went for breakfast and the atmosphere as soon as you walk in is great, the bar looks cute, and I want to come back and sit on the patio. We went for breakfast and I got the Avocado Toast, menu reads "Sourdough toast, fresh avocado, arugula and balsamic glaze" sounds super yummy so I ordered it. What the menu fails to mention is the crushed tomato spread that's on top of the avocado and covers the entire toast. Now I personally do not like tomatoes, so I would have definitely ordered it with no tomatoes had I known it was on there. This pretty much ruined the breakfast for me. The people were very friendly, but we asked for waters as soon as we sat down and never got them. I'm still planning on giving it another go though, and I'll ask if anything has tomatoes.
Very relaxed atmosphere! Great for delicious coffee and food, and for catching up with a friend!
Love, Love Love Grounds & Vine! Owners are personable and cheery, Staff is helpful and smiling, food is great, wine list is expansive, and the Bourbon Pecan Latte is literally the BEST!

Today was our first time at Grounds & Vine, and we had the best experience! We went for lunch, and not only was the food absolutely EXCELLENT (best lunch I've had in a long time!), but the customer service was fantastic. The waitresses were so friendly and accommodating, and the owner came up to talk to us about the business and to ensure that we were happy with our experience. Overall I was so impressed, and I know we will be back!
Excellent!!!
Great weather for lunch on the patio! Had a gift certificate to use and will be back!
Food was good but a little pricey

Small space but HUGE atmosphere. This hidden gem is the best coffee shop I have ever been to. The owners are always there and are checking on you making sure you are happy with everything. Love their menus and especially their coffee!
Great place, awesome, unique food. Tasty salad, cool flatbread pizzas
Always great food & service.  Sweet Tea is the best in NC.  Love coming here.

This was an easy decision rate this place as 5 stars. Incredible food - the turkey gouda sandwich was one of the best I've had. The bread it came on was so addicting - light, fluffy and fresh.

Customer service was attentive and friendly. Atmosphere was charming. I would stop here again gladly any time!

They also have a great selection of coffee.

We found this hidden little gem a what a treasure! The food, wine, and staff were over the top fantastic! My wife & I had a wine flight along with some Flatbreads and they were spot on. Highly recommend this place for wine lovers with gourmet food to boot!

The food and service were great! I have many food allergies, and the staff, including the chef, made themselves available to ensure everything was safe for me.
We only had a short amount of time for dinner that evening, so we want to head back soon for some chill time.  The wine menu looked excellent!

Got the Turkey Gouda sandwich with tater tots. The sandwich was grilled in butter, so it was delicious, but also greasy (I had to wash my hands afterwards). The tots were yummy, but maybe a little overcooked.
Nice coffee  and wine bar with tasty dishes. I had the honey BBQ meatball sliders. Nice patio with great service. Happy to support a local business.
Great little cafe and wine bar. Have lots to eat and drink. Sit at the bar/counter or have a seat a table.

Fully exceeded any and all expectations for breakfast and coffee. The staff was also wonderful and very welcoming and helpful.
We were given great recommendations and the atmosphere was so calming !
We will definitely be back.
Had a delicious dirty chai latte it was so yummy! The price point was right the portions was large! Definitely recommend this hidden gem!
Great to sit out and enjoy the spring with some unique food and good drinks!
Greeat
Lunch was delicious! Service was excellent!
Great coffee and pastries!

I got the Margherita Flatbread with chicken added on top (additional charge for that) and my husband got the Grilled Chicken Salad which were both really amazing! Didn't get to try any coffee yet but I will be back for that. Great service as well and the bathrooms are clean:)

Excellent new place,  we had a cappuccino and latte,  both made very well,  I had the ham and swiss egg bites- good portions and delicious . My wife had the flat bread pizza which was also tasty. Relaxing vibe,  we will be back!

Excellent find today!  Wonderful cup of coffee and a big delicious chocolate chip cookie!  Lots of different choices.  Super nice owners came out to meet us and make sure everything was okay.  Highly recommend!
Delicious food, great service and good options on the menu.
Great out of the way feel even it's right where you're going! Wine prices are excellent also!

I love this place and will be back here every time I visit North Carolina! The staff was very nice and attentive! The atmosphere and decor was beautiful! I order the Sammie and the mocha frappe and I couldn't stop complimenting the owners and staff! I definitely recommend this place to anyone passing through Kannapolis, NC or surrounding Charlotte, NC area!
Stopped in for bagel and coffee.  This was my first visit and I have to say I am impressed.  Nice neighborhood shop.  Good people running it.

Great hidden gem if you love coffee,  wine,  pizza, soup... anything edible! We have gone for brunch twice now. Their coffee options are great. I'm a Chai Latte guy and they make a good. Now, I haven't been to many coffee places that have mouthwatering Flatbreads. Their street corn Flatbread is one of a kind.  The location is great with a cozy indoor space and a nice outdoor extension. The owners are super friendly. BONUS: If you are a comic book fan, three owner has a dream bathroom waiting for it.  Super cool!
Amazing service, atmosphere and food. The waiters were very knowledgeable about the menu. Everything is pretty much made in house, will be coming back again soon.
Coffee was great.  Service is Outstanding.

Everything about this place was perfect. The Cuban was completely delicious as was the Bees Knees Latte. It was, without a doubt, the best latte I've ever had! Fran, my waitress was delightful and sweet. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
Cute lil spot, lovely staff and the coffee was great! Going to come back to try their food!
Great coffee! Lots of great food selections & above all an awesome staff. Just a wonderful warm welcoming atmosphere.

Fantastic food, service, atmosphere. Highly recommend you experience this rare gem. The staff are amazing and inviting. This place feels like home. The Dirty Chai is now my new favorite coffee drink. I have never tasted a take on avocado toast that was so delicious. My husband had the BLT and said it was the best he has ever tasted in his life.  We came there to simply grab and go with 2 coffees and ended up dining in and left with dessert. First time customers and hope to be back next time we are in the area.
One word ... Delicious

My girlfriend and I were visiting from Raleigh, and our friends took us here. The staff is very personable, quick to take care of their customers, and very friendly. Their charcuterie board was actually well put together, and not just random cheeses and meets like other places we have been to. I had the chicken salad sandwich, which was absolutely amazing. It's the best chicken salad I have had, not even close at all. My girlfriend had mexican corn flatbread, which also was delicious. It was hard for me not to eat half of hers after I finished my sandwich. The chef brought out a no-pasta lasagna for us to try, which we finished after we were full from dinner because it was just that good. We tried a few of their sauces as well and had to take 2 of them home. We took home 1 lb. of the chicken salad as well, and I finished half of it as soon as we got back to Raleigh. I wish I could give this place 10 stars, now I just need to find out if they can ship more chicken salad to me! Do not pass this place up, it is phenomenal.

Wonderful experience! We enjoyed wine, appetizers, dinner, dessert, coffee and it was all delicious! Our server was very polite and attentive. The owner was kind enough to tell us about various ingredients they used and where they are locally sourced from. He was very personable and truly appreciated our business. We would highly recommend and will be back!!

Found this place in a quick Google search & decided to try. Nice guy but the other team members were lacking in customer service. No smiles & seemed miserable. Ordered turkey & gouda without tomato & bacon (because it's thick sliced) & asked for roasted peppers to be added instead. Was told there'd be an upcharge to exchange tomatoes & bacon for peppers. Ugh. Then was told by a lady manager that the roasted peppers would "compromise the integrity of the sandwich". So, I didn't get the sandwich the way I wanted & didn't enjoy it. Just a super buttery grilled turkey & cheese. Also ordered tomato bisque soup of the day instead of chips & I got chips.

On a positive note, it's a cute place with a coffee of the day and outdoor seating.
Definitely a place I would return to I love the specialty coffees service and the food too you do a great job preparing some of their dishes

Stopped in for a coffee and it did not disappoint! Delicious and fairly priced. I was eyeing the baked goods but didn't go for it this time. I'll be back for one of those tasty looking pastries at some point!
Great service and food was very good, but atmosphere was a little tense because manager/owner was on top of everything
My wife and I ate lunch here. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and professional. The food was flavorful and fresh. I'll be coming back!
Delicious coffee and food.

Great little spot! The food was excellent and the wine selection is better than a lot of other wine bars in the area. The staff was very nice and the owners came around and chatted with us a few times. I will definitely be back to this hidden little gem.

Cozy Little Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, and dinner place that has a nice wine selection, too. The descent size menu and combined with a mini coffee house as name implies you can not go wrong with either a light or tummy filling meal. Very friendly staff and atmosphere. Food was delish, and you really can't go wrong with anything you order. Prices are what you'd expect from a small personalized restaurant as everything is made from scratch and some items like the bruchetta my wife ordered wad hands down better than most restaurants and major chain Italian restaurants.
Two thumbs up

My husband and I came for breakfast to celebrate our anniversary and we were just blown away. This place was absolutely delicious. I got the sausage and cheddar/ ham/ Swiss egg bites and they were just melt in your mouth. My husband got the sausage/ cheddar and chorizo egg bites and ham and cheese croissant. Everything was beyond amazing and you will not be disappointed. Very clean and intimate atmosphere. Very kind and helpful staff. We will definitely be back. If you're looking for a unique breakfast experience aside from the generic breakfast places.. this place is a must! Local and unique and amazing!
We had a wine flight and a light dinner. Lobster mac n' cheese was delicious! Owners and staff were super friendly! Great chill local spot.

I've enjoyed lunch and dinner here many times over the last year, and it's always the same: DELICIOUS!!  Favorites of mine are the crabmeat salad (when in season), turkey guda sandwich, and the chicken salad croissant.  And, of course, the coffee and wine are great! It's a really nice place to meet my friends for a meal.
High end prices for mid range food.
Every single bit and sip is delicious. You must try the bee's knees! And the employees are kind and attentive.
Great local spot.  Owner and staff give off a warm, welcome vibe.  Ambiance, food, service and coffee all 5 stars.  Will definitely be back.
Great food and friendly atmosphere!!

Came here today with some friends.  First time here.  What a sweet place.  Very cozy, decor and ambience is wonderful.  Food is amazing.  I got the roasted vegetable flatbread, a dark roast coffee and an amazing glass of rose.  My friends got a huge chocolate chip muffin, a margherita flatbread, and a turkey and gouda sandwich. Fantastic service.  Delectable food.  What really impressed me though, besides the above, they have top knotch silverware, wine glasses and napkins.  I give these guys 100/100 and I will be back.
Great Vibe & Atmosphere! I will definitely be back!
Very friendly neighborhood restaurant. Very good food, service and atmosphere. It was nice not being over crowded and rushed.
Great atmosphere, plenty of wine and coffee choices. We didn't have a meal while visiting, but we can't wait to see what they offer.
Really nice people! Great soup and espresso!

Lovely staff. Excellent service. Great food and coffee. Cozy atmosphere with music that is not overbearing but keeps away any awkward silence.

Everytime I've gotten a coffee it has always been scorching hot; just something to be mindful of.

I will recommande this place for great food , and coffee . The food is so good that I had to ask if  they could make their best sandwiches for my company Christmas party and they did . Everyone is still talking about the food and asking me for the address. Some said they have never eaten anything so delicious and fresh at the same time. Service is always great that's why I recommend it to everyone.
Relaxing place
Great place
Amazing place !!
Great coffee, great food, staff is friendly and accommodating. Don't miss out on this hidden gem of a place!
Excellent breakfast spot with great menu (including healthy options). Owner super nice and personable. Loved our coffee and tea. We will be back!!
Excellent little discovery. In fact I plan on being there today before they close at 2
Enjoy meals and coffee here often!!  Great food and awesome staff!!
Kind staff, tasty drinks and food.

Barista pulled a great short espresso and excellent cortado.
Good selection of breakfast pastries and wide variety of other food options.
The coffees and variety of high quality pastries make Grounds & Vine a "Must Try" local breakfast and lunch  spot!! We will definitely return!!  Followus@johncauble on Facebook

Worst service ever! It was the first time being there and we wait at the cashier desk to place our coffee order and waited like 5-7 mins. There was a server inputting an order and told us to hold up. 2 other servers where behind her appeared to be chatting but kept glancing over at me. Finally the server infront of me told the one behind her to get the orders.... GUESS WHAT?! She then went to the people behind me and took there order! She knew I wasn't helped yet. I did not feel welcomed at all!! I felt overlooked and like they didn't want my business. I couldn't tell you why.... I was just standing there quietly waiting to order my coffee and lemonade.
ANYWAY, when I saw her walk around the counter to take the others order instead of mine... I left! I don't stay where I am not wanted. I take my business elsewhere. Don't go here and spend your money as a minority.

This place was recommended to my by 1 of my company's customer. While I was off and was passing by it I decided to stop in and give it a try. I am glad that I did. It's a Great little spot and the owner is a really Nice guy. The food and wine was Good as well. I would recommend stopping by.
My husband and I loved this place. Food is great, I tried salads and veg sandwich, my husband tried chicken salad sandwich. Didn't try wine yet since I was pregnant all the time we had food there.
Cute place. Nice outdoor seating. Great people
Terrific little shop, love the atmosphere and the people are friendly!

They have a wonderful wine selection here. However, the food is quite lacking. We came in for dinner, but the food menu seemed more appropriate for lunch hours. The options were more like (expensive) diner food; not options you would expect at a place that serves nice bottles of wine. The salad dressing came in a plastic package...very diner-esque. Not professional at all.

We were hoping for a new go-to place based on other reviews and word-of-mouth, but the food quality wasn't wonderful. Also hardly any options for vegetarians.  It's a bit strange to serve coffee drinks in to-go cups for those who are dining in. The frappuccino was more of a chocolate slushy, but my husband said the coffee is better than Starbucks (if that's saying much).

Great Cafe with excellent food.
Very friendly and professional staff.
Friendly service. We had a wine flight and ordered food which came out quickly. It was hot and delicious.

First visit did not disappoint! Stopped in for breakfast, ended up with tomato bisque and gourmet grilled cheese. Perfect for a rainy Saturday. Wait staff were attentive, owner Rich stopped by to say hello. Decor is welcoming and has a local art feature wall. Ready to head back soon for a wine afternoon on the patio. Oh, coffee was excellent too.
Had the most delicious latte and chocolate muffin from this cafe. Very friendly staff, lots of drink options, clean place, and comfortable atmosphere.

Great atmosphere, food was fresh, plated beautifully and tasted great. I'm so glad we came upon Grounds & Vine on our way through town. They also have a great wine selection! Service was great too! We'll be back for sure.
Triple G sandwich was so good! Also, filling. I could only eat half

Rich & Sarah are the wonderful owners of this one-of-a-kind independent treasure. They are super friendly and have an exceptional food, coffee and wine selection. We enjoyed the lobster mac & cheese as an appetizer. It was super cheesy and delicious. I had the veggie flatbread and my husband had the BLT. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, wine and atmosphere! I've been here many times and always enjoy the experience!
Love the coffee!

Fast,
knowledgeable,
great attitude!
Super cute place, great atmosphere & food is delicious. The owners are also really sweet.
Great family owned spot! The food was filling and delicious, coffee drinks are well made, and wine selection is robust. Owners were very personable and welcoming.

Amazing food and wine! My Spouse and I had the charcuterie and pimento cheese spread. We also had sandwiches, a Cuban and BLT. We drank a pumpkin spice beer  and a wine flight. Everything was phenomenal! The owner and his wife were both there and took the time to speak extensively with each table re. their experiences. We learned so much about how the business came together and their love for what they do was genuinely reflected in the food.  Such a welcoming atmosphere! Will definitely be back! Highly recommended!
This is a nice, intimate place with a fun menu and great service. Our food was excellent and the service was great. We really enjoyed it and will go back.

Needed some place to have a glass of wine and kill some time before a concert at Village Park. Googled "Wine near Kannapolis" and this was an option that came up. Great atmosphere, very nice owners and staff, and we really enjoyed the wine we selected.
Best BLT I've I've ever had. Had it on sourdough instead of the roll. Delicious!!!
Great food, staff, and environment.
Great wine selection, very friendly staff... definitely recommend!
We really enjoyed Grounds & Vine. The owners and staff were really friendly - we always love that.  Food was great. It's definately worth a try. Super cute place with a nice outside patio.
Delicious food, great beer and wine choices and an amazing decor
I've never had a better chocolate chip muffin in my life,  period.  It makes me wonder about all the rest of their items!  I'll be back to find out!
Everything was delicious! Very welcoming staff. Great experience overall.

This was recommended by a neighbor who said that he was blown away by the food and locally owned business owner walking around checking in on everything.  It was no different for us. We had option to sit outside or inside. Its very limited seating and I almost don't want to share how great they are so they dont get busy.

We did the turkey sandwich and lobster mac and cheese.... I regret not getting the large libster Mac and Cheese... By far some of the best food we have had within 10 miles of our house.

The owner walked around and was extreemly happy we came to try them after hearing about his establishment.  I can see myself stopping for the Lobster Mac and cheese...

Great food and staff. The owner/chef greeted us when we arrived and checked on us periodically to ensure we were satisfied, a rare occurrence in the restaurant business these days.

The indoor dining area is somewhat small, but is pleasantly decorated, and there is a very large outdoor dining area with comfortable seating and umbrella shading... just the thing for those sunny days.

We liked the place so much, we went back three times!

This is a little gem for sure.
The max and cheese is the best I have had in a long time!
Service ***** 5 star
Great food and service.
Lovely atmosphere, very caring owners, and delicious muffins!
Great food, kind staff, amazing coffee!!!
Got my first Americano here this morning, great coffee and staff!

I'm very confused. My family just moved back to the area after living in Huntersville for a few years. This place is new since we have lived here before. We make our espresso at home and called in advance to inquire as to whether they had fresh whole beans for sale and they said they did. When we arrived to the store, we noticed there were customers sitting outside and inside and the OPEN sign on the door was aglow. We went to go inside and the door was locked. The people inside sitting at the bar just stared at me and didn't open the door. I decided I wasn't welcome there and began to leave when another couple behind us tried the door again, locked. Except this time they were immediately let in by the workers. The couple held the door open for us and we decided to come in. Upon entering the building, we were given extremely dirty looks by two customers sitting at the bar and one employee sitting at the bar having her lunch. There were a couple other workers behind the bar, none of which greeted us (nor did the one sitting at the bar). We asked for a pound of coffee and while we waited for the barista to prepare it, we were continuously given an unwelcome glare from both the employee at the bar and the 2 customers. I basically picked up the vibe that this place was for "members-only" or something. I felt extremely unwelcome. Also, the beans we paid $17 (for ONE POUND) for were not fresh...which is extremely disappointing when I could have gone to Lowe's foods on a Friday and gotten a pound of wonderfully fresh beans for $5.

I'm really not sure what my husband and I (and our toddler) did to be treated so strangely. I'm super disappointed because this place seemed really cool and the food looked good, but it's not worth it for us. I've never felt so uncomfortable at a coffee shop in my life.

Wonderful.  Great indoor and outdoor seating. I had the charcuterie plate and they had the best priced wine list i have ever seen .i even had the pleasure of meeting the chef..The service was superb. I will be ding there many times to cone.
Great menu, excellent service! I'm glad I tried them out!!

My coworker and I swung in here for lunch today. I had the Veggie sandwich and they were nice enough to allow me to swap out the roasted peppers for tomatoes and the Sammie hit the spot! The lemon Mayo that comes on it paired so well with the roasted veggies and feta. Highly recommend. The owner also asked how everything was and he was very nice. Will be back when we are back in the area.

Great place to eat, excellent service, friendly staff
Would visit again when in the area.
Cozy little cafe with great food and a variety of drink options available.
Had dinner here tonight for the first time - was delicious!! Rich and Sarah are amazing hosts! Definitely will be back - nice atmosphere!!
Excellent little place to grab lunch. Great atmosphere, fair prices and good food. I had the Concord Cuban and it was delicious. I'll definitely be stopping in here frequently.

Loved this cute place. The coffee bar was amazing. The staff was so friendly and willing to make the experience wonderful. The owner, Rich, took the time to introduce himself and talk with us. Great atmosphere!
Excellent food and service. Wonderful owners.

Lovely little spot. Enjoyed the raspberry lemonade, lobster mac & cheese, Mexican street corn flatbread, and a slice of turtle cheesecake. The owners and staff are friendly and attentive. I'll be back!
My new favorite spot. Always excellent food, friendly staff, and the best coffee in town.
Chef personally spoke with us! Very kind and food was immaculate!

Just tried the G&V.  Atmosphere is great.  It looks like it would be a great coffee shop but it's so much more.  The food was fabulous and the service was top notch.  They had more wine and beer than we thought they would.  Good selection.  We will definitely be back.
Received great service. Loved the coffee and Big G sandwich!
Drinks, music, and dancing. Great time

Great coffee, especially if you're a caffeine fiend like I am. Good place for a small breakfast or lunch. We had breakfast that entailed a cinnamon roll, apple cream cheese muffin, and egg bites; this was accompanied by a chai latte, dirty chai, and an americano. Very friendly staff and owners that take the time to explain their story and what they're about. All in all, good experience. Will be back!
Such a great idea to combine a coffee cafe and wine bar. Only had the chance to try the coffee during my stay but for sure when I am back will have to try the wine they offer.

This spot is absolutely adorable! The atmosphere and style enjoyable. Perfect for a business lunch, break from the office or just hanging with friends. Food was delicious! Turkey and Gouda on Sourdough will change your life! Cant wait till my next visit, if you haven't gone....your missing out!
Great spot, albeit a challenge to get to. Baristas were friendly. We enjoyed being there. Coffee and pastry were very good. Lovely decor. Check it out!
